CFM.synopsis: Nightsong speaks with Shadowheart about Shadowheart's parents, causing Shadowheart to remember the truth. Shadowheart reflects that she needs to recover her memories in Baldur's Gate. Nightsong gives Shadowheart an artifact and a blessing.
CFM.how_to_trigger: Go to SCLHave SH in your party/be SHUse origin debug book -> Shadowheart -> Act 2 -> Epilogue -> Camp NightLong RestTalk to Aylin

CFM_94.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_94.text: What do you know about me? You spoke of my past, being chased by wolves - I told no one about that...

CFM_109.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_109.text: ...Almost no one. But I certainly didn't share that with you.

CFM_140.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_140.text: There is nothing I can tell you that you do not already know yourself. They trained you well, trained you hard. Chiselled away any part of you that did not fit their plan. They made you forget.

CFM_39.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_39.text: I chose to do that. For the mission. To protect Shar's -

CFM_169.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_169.text: - secrets. Yes, yes. That is an old song, girl. Your goddess cares more for her precious secrets than she does her devotees.
CFM_169.context: NodeContext: Interrupting Shadowheart to finish her sentence for her.

CFM_136.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_136.text: When you freed me, you severed a bond between me and that dog, Thorm. A bond of pain - his, inflicted on me.

CFM_17.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_17.text: When I laid eyes on you, I sensed a similar bond. You, tethered to two others, someplace distant. Let me help you remember.

CFM_145.speaker: Narrator
CFM_145.text: *You feel Shadowheart's mind tug at the edges of your own. You know this sensation. She wants you to see whatever is about to be revealed.*

CFM_176.speaker: Player
CFM_176.text: Open your mind to that sensation.

CFM_63.speaker: Narrator
CFM_63.text: *Your mind joins with Shadowheart's. Something pulls at you both, bringing you elsewhere...*

CFM_118.speaker: Narrator
CFM_118.text: *Something sparks in your memory. Teachings about Selûnite rites of passage, about how they would abandon their children out in the wilds and force them to find their way home...*

CFM_64.speaker: Narrator
CFM_64.text: *You remember that it is a common rite amongst Selûne's followers to send their children off into the woods to find their way home. Perhaps this time it had gone awry.*

CFM_101.speaker: Narrator
CFM_101.text: *...It seems that one child never came back. She was taken.*

CFM_158.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_158.text: You already know. Did you not see yourself in him? Do you not recognise your own blood?

CFM_22.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_22.text: That is him. He lives still, and your mother too.

CFM_31.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_31.text: No, it can't be. I'm an orphan.

CFM_167.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_167.text: And who told you that? Your adoptive family? You are not to blame. You were young, impressionable. They took you because they wanted to break and remake you.

CFM_202.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_202.text: But you are a child no longer. You are a woman. One who knows what must be done.

CFM_155.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_155.text: My parents. I need to save them.

CFM_40.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_40.text: Your parents are with your abductors. You will need to return to their lair. But be warned.

CFM_164.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_164.text: You may have once thought of them as comrades, mentors, friends, even lovers. They will all be enemies now.

CFM_2.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_2.text: You have been forewarned for what is to come, but not yet forearmed.
CFM_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong produces something - the Spear of Night.

CFM_93.speaker: Player
CFM_93.text: The Spear of Night? I thought that was cast into the Shadowfell.

CFM_125.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_125.text: I was able to retrieve it, before it sank too far into Shar's umbral domain.

CFM_157.speaker: Player
CFM_157.text: Careful - isn't that thing supposed to be able to kill you?

CFM_9.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_9.text: It no longer has the power to harm me, now that I've removed it from Shar's domain.

CFM_20.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_20.text: Shar is quick to discard whatever she has no use for. I think you know that well enough.

CFM_111.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_111.text: But I felt it call to me as I took flight. Whatever Shar calls her own, Selûne has equal claim to. They are one and the same. Their power is matched...

CFM_1.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_1.text: ...and mirrored. Take it - you will find it useful. What you do with it... that will be up to you. Same as before.
CFM_1.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong sweeps her palm down the length of the spear. It glows with ethereal selunite power.

CFM_74.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_74.text: First Selûne's blessing, and now her gifts. If only the old me could see this...
CFM_74.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH accepts the spear (out-of-frame handover)NodeContext: Wry

CFM_127.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_127.text: Forget her. She was forged by lies. Be guided only by who you have become.

CFM_184.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_184.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

CFM_147.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_147.text: Shar torments you still. What a spiteful creature she is. This will not stop until you take action.
CFM_147.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small shake of the head. Empathy for SH aftter seeing her be tormented with magic pain by Shar.NodeContext: Reacting to Shadowheart having just been inflicted with a spasm of magic pain. Empathy towards SH. Scorn for Shar.

CFM_100.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_100.text: See that your parents' sacrifices are not in vain: allow the Moonmaiden to guide you at last.

CFM_32.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH accepts the spear (out-of-frame handover)

CFM_156.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_156.text: A debt repaid. You returned my life unto me. Now go and claim your own.

CFM_189.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_189.text: I'll need every advantage, it seems... Thank you.
CFM_189.context: CinematicNodeContext: SH accepts the spear (out-of-frame handover)

CFM_10.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_10.text: The Spear. How do you have it? I threw it into the Shadowfell.

CFM_86.speaker: Player
CFM_86.text: Perhaps this isn't a good idea.

CFM_186.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_186.text: That is for Shadowheart to decide.

CFM_79.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_79.text: There are always other concerns. Let Shadowheart at least be forewarned.

CFM_98.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_98.text: You will have to face your abductors in their very lair, in Baldur's Gate.

CFM_108.speaker: Player
CFM_108.text: Does this mean you're a Selûnite?

CFM_168.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_168.text: Your parents both followed the Moonmaiden. I could sense their faith, even in a brief glimpse of the past.

CFM_91.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_91.text: You were to receive Selûne's guidance in those woods. You were to come of age. Instead, Shar's followers snatched you. They must have been watching you for a long time.

CFM_24.speaker: Player
CFM_24.text: Getting your parents back sounds dangerous.

CFM_162.speaker: Player
CFM_162.text: I'm sorry for your parents, but we have other concerns.

CFM_171.speaker: Isobel
CFM_171.text: It is a tragedy that the Moonmaiden's rite was perverted by Shar. Your future was stolen from you.

CFM_54.speaker: Player
CFM_54.text: Close your mind. This is for her alone.

CFM_8.speaker: Narrator
CFM_8.text: *You feel Shadowheart's mind tug at the edges of your thoughts. She wants you to stay with her, to see whatever is about to be revealed to you.*

CFM_122.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_122.text: It is time we spoke about your heritage. There is a debt I must repay.
CFM_122.context: CinematicNodeContext: NS cocks her head as she looks at SH in curiosity, taking in her altered appearance post-Shar's wrath.

CFM_68.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_68.text: You claimed to know something about me - you knew about the wolves. Tell me everything.

CFM_126.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_126.text: There is nothing I can tell you that you do not already know yourself. They trained you well, trained you hard. Chiselled away any part of you that did not fit their plan. They made you forget.

CFM_48.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_48.text: Shar's embrace is something that was forced upon you. It is not your true nature.

CFM_70.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_70.text: My heritage? What are you talking about?

CFM_103.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_103.text: Come now. I do not believe you did not suspect something was amiss. No true Sharran would have hesitated to skewer my heart.

CFM_88.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_88.text: The natural conclusion is that you are no true Sharran, and never were.

CFM_172.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_172.text: That can't be. I was always loyal to Shar.

CFM_97.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_97.text: ...Until you weren't. Do you think it was but a brief lapse? A moment of madness? No. I think you finally listened to your heart.

CFM_58.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_58.text: Perhaps it was just a mistake. A moment of madness.

CFM_99.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_99.text: No. A moment of clarity. You finally listened to yourself, and stopped resisting your true nature.

CFM_53.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_53.text: I think you might be right.

CFM_11.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_11.text: Of course I am. And I can prove it.

CFM_106.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_106.text: When you freed me from the Shadowfell, you severed a bond between me and that dog, Thorm. A bond of pain - his, inflicted on me.

CFM_5.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_5.text: When I laid eyes on you, I sensed a similar bond. You, tethered to two others, someplace distant.

CFM_120.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_120.text: Let me help you remember so there will be no doubt.

CFM_82.speaker: Narrator
CFM_82.text: *A memory appears at the forefront of your mind.*

CFM_182.speaker: Narrator
CFM_182.text: *You remember sermons about Selûnite rites of passage, about how they would abandon their children out in the wilds and force them to find their way home...*

CFM_95.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_95.text: How do I know this isn't some trick? You could have tampered with my memories.

CFM_78.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_78.text: I am a daughter of Selûne - we illuminate darkness. We do not not create it.

CFM_193.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_193.text: The elf you saw was your father. He tried to stop you being seized by Shar's agents, but failed.

CFM_174.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_174.text: But I am not here to convince you, only show you a path. Whether you follow it or not is up to you.

CFM_96.speaker: Narrator
CFM_96.text: *You remember that it is a common rite amongst Selûne's followers to send their children off into the woods to find their way home. Perhaps this time it had gone awry.*

CFM_7.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_7.text: That wolf - that elf... Who was he?

CFM_83.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_83.text: You already know who he is. Did you not see yourself in him? Do you not recognise your own blood?

CFM_14.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_14.text: He is your father - and he lives still, as does your mother. I felt them, bound to you.

CFM_27.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_27.text: That can't be. I'm an orphan.

CFM_61.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_61.text: And who told you that? Your adoptive family? You are not to blame. You were young, impressionable. They took you because they wanted to break and remake you.

CFM_175.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_175.text: But you are a child no longer. You are a woman. One who knows what must be done.

CFM_85.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_85.text: I have to find my parents.

CFM_185.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_185.text: You will have to face your abductors in their very lair, in Baldur's Gate.

CFM_13.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_13.text: You may have once thought of them as comrades, mentors, friends, even lovers. But they will all be enemies now.

CFM_131.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_131.text: There is one more way in which I can help you. You have been forewarned, and now you shall be forearmed.

CFM_59.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_59.text: You will remember this spear, no doubt? It was to be the instrument of my death. Now it will become a parting gift in exchange for my life.
CFM_59.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong produces the Spear of Night, holding it in both hands.

CFM_115.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_115.text: Shar's weapon? Surely it's useless now.

CFM_116.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_116.text: For her purposes, perhaps. Shar is quick to discard whatever she has no use for. I think you know that well enough.

CFM_21.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_21.text: I felt the Spear call to me as I took flight. Whatever Shar calls her own, Selûne has equal claim to. They are one and the same. Their power is matched...

CFM_80.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_80.text: ...and mirrored. Take it - you will need it. But what you do with it... that will be up to you. Same as before.
CFM_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong sweeps her palm down the length of the spear. It glows with ethereal selunite power.

CFM_183.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_183.text: First Selûne's blessing, and now her gifts. If only the old me could see this...

CFM_124.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_124.text: Forget her. She was forged by lies. Be guided only by who you have become.
CFM_124.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong mimes handing over the spear to Avatar SH, who puts it away.

CFM_178.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_178.text: I have kept my word. My guidance in exchange for my freedom.

CFM_43.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_43.text: There must be more you can tell me.

CFM_41.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_41.text: Your mind is a deep, dark wood. There are dead ends, shadowy corners, lurking threats. I was lucky to be able to glean as much as I did.

CFM_51.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_51.text: Besides, there are more hardships ahead. Knowing too much may cause you to despair, while a little ignorance may shield you.

CFM_52.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_52.text: One last thing: your parents have been in the hands of Shar's followers for some forty years. It must take tremendous will for mortals to hold out that long.

CFM_153.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_153.text: See that their sacrifices are not in vain: allow the Moonmaiden to guide you at last.

CFM_71.speaker: Narrator
CFM_71.text: *She speaks pure heresy, or so you would have once thought. But you can deny it no longer - a new presence empowers you. You felt it ever since the Shadowfell. Selûne.*

CFM_133.speaker: Narrator
CFM_133.text: *Pain surges from the wound on your hand... but no memory comes with it - no lesson. Just agony.*
CFM_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shadowheart reacts to the pain of the incurable wound in her right hand. She raises the hand and grimaces in pain. After a brief moment the pain passes and she lowers her hand, face relaxing, returning to default pose.

CFM_152.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_152.text: Shar toys with you still. What a spiteful creature she is. This will not stop until you take action.
CFM_152.context: CinematicNodeContext: Small shake of the head. Empathy for SH aftter seeing her be tormented with magic pain by Shar.NodeContext: Reacting to Shadowheart having just been inflicted with a spasm of magic pain. Empathy towards SH. Scorn for Shar.

CFM_163.speaker: Narrator
CFM_163.text: *Take action, yes... but freeing your parents will take time. Perhaps there is something more immediate you can do - something symbolic, to put Shar behind you for good.*

CFM_36.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_36.text: You still wear your hair like that of a novice. You should change it.

CFM_60.speaker: Narrator
CFM_60.text: *A long, sleepless night awaits. But come dawn, you will have reclaimed a little piece of yourself.*

CFM_107.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_107.text: This is not the time for symbolic gestures. You must stay focused.

CFM_23.speaker: Narrator
CFM_23.text: *Rest beckons. Soon you will be in Baldur's Gate, where you must confront those who wronged you, and save those who were taken from you.*

CFM_19.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_19.text: Perhaps I was foolish to spare you. It may have been better to remain ignorant.

CFM_102.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_102.text: Do not pine for the nightmare now that you are finally awake.

CFM_62.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_62.text: We are. Good fortune on your road ahead. It will not be easy, but it will certainly be enlightening.

CFM_67.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_67.text: A debt repaid. You gave me my life back. Now go and claim your own.
CFM_67.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong mimes handing over the spear to Avatar SH, who puts it away.

CFM_123.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_123.text: I'll need every advantage, it seems... Thank you.

CFM_159.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_159.text: I thought that was lost in the Shadowfell. How do you have it?

CFM_143.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_143.text: Shar is quick to discard whatever she has no use for. I think you know that well enough.

CFM_87.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_87.text: I just want to remember what I lost.

CFM_77.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_77.text: Shar may seek to thwart you in that - if she cannot control you, she can at least seek to deny you your past.

CFM_190.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_190.text: If you want to remember, you will have to face your abductors in their very lair, in Baldur's Gate.

CFM_149.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_149.text: I'm going to make them pay for what they did to me.

CFM_84.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_84.text: Yes, a pain that I understand all too well.

CFM_173.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_173.text: I just want to move on with my life.

CFM_141.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_141.text: What life? The lie you've led until this moment? Confront the past, or your future is nothing but a coward's charade.

CFM_3.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_3.text: They were seized by Shar's followers, same as you. Only you were to be remoulded for their purposes, while your parents... I sense they have suffered greatly in the years since.

CFM_34.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_34.text: But now the veil has been parted. You know what must be done, I trust?

CFM_187.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_187.text: I... I don't know what to say. I don't know these people.

CFM_132.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_132.text: That is how Shar wished it to be. She robbed you of your childhood, all to spite her twin.

CFM_200.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_200.text: That was a Selûnite ritual, wasn't it? So that means...

CFM_76.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_76.text: Your parents both followed the Moonmaiden. I could sense their faith, even in a brief glimpse of the past.

CFM_56.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_56.text: You were to receive my mother's guidance in those woods. You were to come of age. Instead, Shar's followers snatched you. They must have been watching you for a long time.

CFM_6.speaker: Isobel
CFM_6.text: It is a tragedy that the Moonmaiden's rite was perverted by Shar. Your future was stolen from you.

CFM_89.speaker: Nightsong
CFM_89.text: The elf you saw was your father. He tried to stop them, but failed.

CFM_117.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_117.text: Whatever you have to say, just say it.

CFM_105.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_105.text: You claimed to know something about me - you knew about the wolves. Tell me everything.

CFM_142.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_142.text: That can't be. I was always loyal to Shar.

CFM_199.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_199.text: That wolf - that elf... Who was he?

CFM_114.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_114.text: That can't be. I'm an orphan.

CFM_12.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_12.text: I have to find my parents.

CFM_166.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_166.text: I thought that was lost in the Shadowfell. How do you have it?

CFM_135.speaker: Shadowheart
CFM_135.text: There must be more you can tell me.
